DataElement.preferredName: Osteoclast Targeted Therapy Negation Use Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An explanation for why osteoclast targeted therapy was not used.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A large, multinucleated cell that secretes bone-degrading enzymes in the processes of normal bone remodeling and pathological bone loss. Osteoclasts are derived from macrophages._A type of treatment that uses drugs or other substances, such as monoclonal antibodies, to identify and attack specific cancer cells. Targeted therapy may have fewer side effects than other types of cancer treatments._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._To put into action or service.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A large, multinucleated cell that secretes bone-degrading enzymes in the processes of normal bone remodeling and pathological bone loss. Osteoclasts are derived from macrophages.:A type of treatment that uses drugs or other substances, such as monoclonal antibodies, to identify and attack specific cancer cells. Targeted therapy may have fewer side effects than other types of cancer treatments.

Concepts.definition: A large, multinucleated cell that secretes bone-degrading enzymes in the processes of normal bone remodeling and pathological bone loss. Osteoclasts are derived from macrophages.

A type of cancer treatment that uses testing and medication to more precisely identify and treat cancer. These treatments target and disable genes or proteins necessary to the proliferation of cancer cells.

To put into action or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

Concepts.definition: A directive to indicate a response not listed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An acute or chronic condition that is characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood.

Concepts.definition: An acute or chronic condition that is characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic (benign or malignant) disorder affecting the teeth.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic (benign or malignant) disorder affecting the teeth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hypocalemia; lower than normal levels of calcium in the circulating blood.

Concepts.definition: Lower than normal levels of calcium in the circulating blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hypophosphatemia; lower than normal levels of phosphates in the circulating blood.

Concepts.definition: Lower than normal levels of phosphates in the circulating blood.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.
